alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 31 at 8:32PM CDT until May 31 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Armstrong County in the Panhandle of Texas... Randall County in the Panhandle of Texas... Western Carson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Western Hutchinson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Potter County in the Panhandle of Texas... Moore County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 831 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Masterson to 10 miles southeast of Valley De Oro to 7 miles south of Canyon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. * Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Dumas, Canyon, Borger, Panhandle, Claude, Fritch, Sunray, Stinnett, Lake Tanglewood, Sanford, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Valley De Oro, Washburn, Umbarger, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Four Way and Masterson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Carson; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall
